summary: Taiwan-based tech company Foxconn has acquired the Fairbanks Logistics Park, an industrial property situated on 100 acres in northwest Houston . The site includes four buildings totaling 1 million square feet of industrial space . Foxconn is reportedly investing $450 million to build an AI server manufacturing facility .  Ingrasys USA, a Foxconn subsidiary, acquired the property in March for $142 million . Apple plans to build a 250,000-square-foot server manufacturing facility scheduled to open in 2026 .  Tech giant Foxconn creating 600 jobs with $450M Houston investment . to open in 2026 . Tech giant to invest in Houston, Texas .

Arm Holdings’ ARM core strength in power-efficient chip architecture continues to secure its leadership in the mobile computing space . The company’s ability to deliver high performance on minimal power makes its chips ideal for the increasingly connected, intelligent world .  Arm Holdings has surged 11% in the past three months, significantly underperforming the industry’s 24% rally . Apple, Qualcomm, and Samsung each scale their AI capabilities and broaden their IoT strategies . ARM is no longer just the mobile chip enabler; it's becoming an indispensable AI and IoT infrastructure layer .  ARM trades at a forward price-to-sales ratio of 28.31, well above the industry’s 8.12 . It carries a Value Score of F. ARM stock currently carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks .

Todd Weaver argues companies can indeed do it successfully, and at a similar or only slightly higher cost . Weaver should know: His startup, Purism, is among the few, if not the only business, that assembles smartphones in the U.S. He says his company has managed to make it work and has been profitable for two years .  President Donald Trump recently put U.S. smartphone production in the spotlight as part of his global trade war . Apple has long assembled its iPhones overseas, mainly in China .  Purism has sold just tens of thousands of phones since debuting its first model in 2018 . Its Liberty Phone, manufactured near San Diego, comes with U.S.-made electronics installed on a metal chassis from China . The company also produces tablet computers, laptops, and servers .  Purism’s phones come with kill switches that disconnect their device from cell service, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth . When turned on, the switches sever the electrical circuit to the features they control and make it impossible for hackers to access them . The phones also run on a Linux-based open source operating system .  Purism’s biggest customers are government agencies, many of which require high security, and individual consumers . Customers can pay extra to have their devices shipped with “tamper evident tape” on the packaging, among other options .  Purism’s assembly line is in Carlsbad, Calif., where up to a dozen workers put together devices . The area is home to a pool of skilled labor thanks to the local defense industry and manufacturing for other mobile carriers . Weaver: U.S. is at a huge disadvantage to China when it comes to skilled workers .  Manufacturing in the U.S. also comes with higher labor costs than in China . Training enough people for such a massive undertaking would take years, Weaver said . Purism took several years to develop its domestic supply chain .  One analyst has said iPhones could end up costing $3,500 if made in the U.S., to account for extra costs and hassles . But given enough time, Apple could substantially reduce the cost after developing a new supply chain, finding enough workers and relying on extensive automation .  Trump’s tariffs would be far more effective if phased in over many years, Weaver said . Weaver argues his U.S. manufacturing effort is already paying off and that it will gain momentum over time . The Liberty Phone is Purism's biggest seller .  Purism can be a successful niche player, but the odds of success are lower thanks to the bigger brands . Weaver is trying to raise additional investment after taking in $16 million in funding over the years . Some of that money would go to fixing a shortcoming with his phones .  This article was originally featured onFortune.com . It was originally published in May 2014.com.com/Fortune .com/2013/2014/2014 .

Apple sought to put the order on hold after it was issued by U.S. District Judge Yvonne Gonzalez-Rogers in a stinging rebuke . The setback threatens to divert billions of dollars in revenue away from Apple .  The antitrust case focused largely on the 15% to 30% commissions that Apple rakes in from a portion of the commerce conducted within iPhone apps . Apple is still seeking to overturn the ruling in the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals . Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney: “The long national nightmare of the Apple tax is ended"  Epic asked Gonzalez-Rogers to hold Apple in contempt of her order . Apple complied by requiring commissions of 12% to 27%, provoking Epic to ask her to hold the company in contempt .

Apple is bracing for a 23% EPS headwind after a federal appeals court upheld an injunction requiring link-out payments in the App Store . The App Store generates about $21 billion in annual sales, with roughly $7 billion of that coming from U.S. developer fees . Despite this ruling taking effect April 30, May App Store revenue climbed 13% overall .  Gaming accounts for about 65% of U.S. App Store sales, mostly $0.99 one-time purchases . If users switch to payment platforms like Stripe, they could end up paying 3% plus 30 cents per transaction . Apple insists that over 90% of 2024 billings incurred no commission and emphasizes App Store's role in helping developers reach a global audience .  Tata already assembles iPhones at three South India facilities . Taiwan's Wistron unit, ICT Service Management Solutions, will now carry out repairs at its Karnataka assembly site .

The OnePlus Pad 3 will be available on July 8 for $700 in the US and $1,000 in Canada . The company is touting faster performance, an improved display and upgraded multitasking features . Android tablets have failed to make much of a dent in Apple’s tablet business .  The Pad 3 is less than 6 millimeters thick and features a 13.2-inch display with a higher pixel density than the iPad Air . It's powered by Qualcomm Inc.’s Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, a processor found in Samsung's Galaxy S25 Edge phone .  The $50 folio case is a highlight, with a versatile design that lets you position the tablet in several different orientations . The company is also releasing updated accessories for the Pad 3, including a $200 keyboard with trackpad and stylus pen .  $700, the Pad 3 is $150 more expensive than the company’s previous tablet . Electronics makers continue to grapple with uncertainty around tariffs that the Trump administration has levied against most US trading partners .  Migrants to Rwanda After the UK Decides Not to send them to Rwanda . Migrants will be sent to Rwanda after the UK decides not to let them leave the UK .

Apple’s attempt to pause a lower court ruling that forces it to allow third-party payment links in its App Store was denied by the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals . JPMorgan expects margin uplift for developers like Match Group, Bumble, Roblox, andDuolingo . Spotify, Amazon Kindle and Epic Games may also benefit from increased user acquisition .  Morgan Stanley: 28% of U.S. iPhone users may bypass Apple’s in-app payment system, putting “2% of Apple EPS at risk” Evercore ISI: “The risk to the Services business has been a key factor in Apple's -19% YTD performance”  Apple bid to halt app store order denied . Mizuho upgrades Visa as it sees decade-long growth from cash-to-card shift . HSBC upgrades Dr Reddy’s on weight loss drug semaglutide-driven earnings rebound .

Report: Apple's App Store facilitated almost $1.3 trillion in sales and billings in 2024 . 78% of sales came from physical goods and services such as in-app purchases for games . China accounted for the largest market for physical goods by far .  Study: 10% of $1.3 trillion was subject to commissions . Apple collects a 30% commission on the sale of digital goods and services purchased through the App Store . Governments worldwide are scrutinizing Apple's App Store practices .  Epic Games initially accused Apple of violating antitrust laws by requiring developers to use Apple's in-app payment system . A judge ruled that Apple didn't hold a monopoly over the market for digital mobile gaming transactions . Apple did, however, collect a 27% commission on those payments .  Apple currently collects roughly $20 billion per year in fees from Google as part of an agreement that requires Apple to make Google the default search engine for its Safari web browser . That deal could be on the chopping block as Google's antitrust battle with the Justice Department continues .

WhyLabs was spun out of the Allen Institute for AI and gained traction with its observability platform, which was recently upgraded for real-time security monitoring of generative AI applications . According to GeekWire,Perry Wu, former general partner atAI Fund, lists the company on his LinkedIn profile as “Acq by Apple”  WhyLabs was founded by a powerhouse team of AI experts . The startup gained early attention following its $10 million Series A round in 2021, co-led by Andrew Ng's AI Fund and Defy Partners .  WhyLabs quickly carved out a niche as one of the few AI infrastructure startups focused on observability . Apple has steadily expanded its presence in Seattle, making the city a quiet hub for its AI ambitions .  WhyLabs' technology could play a central role in Apple's push to close the perceived innovation gap with OpenAI, Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT), and Google . Apple recently announced investments in on-device AI features including updates rumored for iOS and Siri .  Was Jeff Bezos-Backed WhyLabs Secretly Acquired By Apple After $10M Series A To Compete In AI Arms Race Against Google, OpenAI, And Microsoft?

Needham downgrades Apple to hold from buy, withdraws $225 price target . Needham cited weak expectations for iPhone upgrade cycle, expensive valuation versus peers . Counterpoint Research slashed its 2025 global smartphone shipment growth forecast to 1.9%, down from 4.2% .  The downgrade comes ahead of Apple's Worldwide Developers Conference next week . The company is expected to unveil new iOS features and possibly announce a generative AI partnership with Google . Apple shares were little changed near $203 on Wednesday .

Beijing's internet regulator has yet to approve the launch of Apple Intelligence, AI-powered tools built using Alibaba's technology . The hold-up puts pressure on Apple as it tries to regain footing in its second-largest market .  Alibaba shares had rallied after the deal was revealed in February, but rivals such as Baidu are moving fast in the AI space, raising competition risks . The delay also dims momentum for Alibaba as rivals like Huawei and Xiaomi push AI-driven devices .

Apple shares are wavering this year amid Donald Trump's tariff plans and his insistence that the company make its flagship product in the US . Gene Munster, Deepwater Asset Management managing partner, said in a program on CNBC that Apple is going through a "fluid" situation .  Sands Capital Select Growth Fund stated the following regarding Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) in itsQ1 2025 investor letter: Apple’s iPhone 16 has not shown promising growth prospects yet, and investors are still in a wait-and-see mode on the AI platform .

Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says his company's crucial partnership with OpenAI is changing . The world’s largest software maker is seen as a leader in commercializing AI due to its relationship with ChatGPT . Still, there have been signs of friction between the companies as each launches competing products .  OpenAI is Microsoft’s largest infrastructure customer . Nadella: “Why would any one of us want to go upset that?” The current contract continues through 2030, but a revision earlier this year allows OpenAI to rent computing power from other providers .  Microsoft has been weaving AI tools into its suite of business applications . Nadella is keen to use AI to reboot Microsoft’s consumer business, which has struggled against its peers . The company is celebrating its 50th anniversary this year .  Last month, ChatGPT was downloaded 105 million times between Apple and Android mobile phones . Microsoft's Copilot assistant, dubbed Copilot, has gained some traction but is up against steep competition from OpenAI . Nadella points out that because Microsoft provides much of OpenAI’s computing, his company makes money .  Trump Considers Deporting Migrants to Rwanda after the UK Decides Not to . Trump considers deporting migrants to Rwanda, but UK decides not to do so .

Apple has engaged Tata Group to manage repairs for its iPhones and MacBook devices . The move indicates a deepening involvement of the Indian conglomerate in the supply chain of the U.S. tech behemoth . Apple is looking for manufacturing opportunities outside China, has picked Tata as a key supplier .  Robinhood stock edges higher on strong May 2025 operating data . Apple Hamilton Insurance: BMO Capital says multiple re-rating now less likely .

Gene Munster, a prominent tech analyst, has shared his insights on Apple's upcoming Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) and the company's future in artificial intelligence (AI) Munster suggested that the WWDC would focus on traditional operating system updates . He estimated that Apple has about two years to get its AI strategy right, but it will require increased investments .  The much-anticipated AI-first device from theJony Ive–Sam Altmancollaboration is expected to be unveiled next year and released in 2026 . However, he highlighted the importance of increased investment in AI as Apple is lagging in this area .  Munster’s predictions come at a crucial time for Apple, which has been facing criticism over its AI efforts . Munster said Apple still has a window of opportunity to strengthen its position in the AI market .  On a year-to-date basis, the shares of Apple dropped 16.64% according to data from Benzinga Pro . Apple shares are in the 33rd percentile for growth, reflecting mixed performance .

Apple has brought in Tata Group to handle repairs for iPhones and MacBook devices in its fast-growing Indian market . As Apple looks beyond China for manufacturing, Tata has fast emerged as its key supplier . Tata already assembles iPhones for local and foreign markets at three facilities in south India .  Apple a 7% market share, compared to just 1% in 2020 . Latest contract award signals Apple's growing confidence on Tata as it hopes to win more business from the world's most valuable smartphone company . Apple and Wistron did not respond to requests for comment .  U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on China, India is also emerging as a favoured destination for iPhone exports . Apple CEO Tim Cook has said the bulk of iPhones sold in the United States during June quarter will be made at factories in India .

Apple's iPhone sales grew by just under 2% last quarter . Tariffs and a fumbled artificial intelligence strategy could further impact its near-term growth prospects . Despite all the negativity surrounding the stock, this is still Apple -- one of the strongest brands in the world .  Apple has pushed back on the release of some of its more advanced AI features until next year . It's a problematic situation given that its rivals already have AI-powered phones available on the market . Another problem is that Apple faces a lot of exposure totariffsas it makes the vast majority of its products in China .  Apple is still around a $3 trillion market cap despite its poor start this year . But with a lower valuation, it's trading at 31 times its trailing earnings, which is only slightly above its five-year average . Apple's iPhone sales increased by just under 2% to $46.8 billion in the first three months of the year .  At its current valuation, you would still be paying a high multiple for a business that's growing in just single digits . This can still be a good long-term buy but I wouldn't consider buying shares of Apple unless it were to fall further in value . Due to its poor AI deployment and slow growth, investors should demand more of a discount . Microsoft first became the world's biggest company based on market cap in September 1998 . It stayed No. 1 for less than 18 months before being dethroned . Nvidia is in the best position to knock Microsoft off its perch with its market cap already topping $3.3 trillion .  Nvidia is poised to be the biggest beneficiary of several artificial intelligence (AI) trends, notably including the rapid adoption of AI agents that can reason . The restrictions on AI chip exports to China will hurt its growth to some extent . I don't think this headwind will keep Nvidia from becoming much larger over the next decade .  The big question hovering over Apple is: What's the next big breakthrough product for the company? I think smart glasses just might be the much-anticipated next huge hit for Apple . Rumors are circulating that the company plans to launch its first AI-enhanced glasses as early as late 2026 .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) will be able to hold on to its leadership in the cloud services market more strongly than I anticipated in the past . Without OpenAI's ChatGPT, I don't believe Microsoft would claim the largest market cap today . Another reason why I'm more optimistic about Amazon now is that it might be able launch smart glasses that become nearly as must-have as the iPhone years ago .  Amazon must grow significantly faster than Microsoft over the next 10 years for its market cap to become larger . Its AI initiatives are impressive, including the development of its own AI chips . Amazon is also expanding into new businesses, with the recent launch of its Project Kuiper satellites .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is994% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172%for the S&P 500 . If you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $865,550!  Microsoft will be worth more than Microsoft 10 years from now, according to The Motley Fool . Microsoft is a long-term value-in-demand stock that could be worth much more .

Jim Cramer talked about Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) on May 27 . Cramer noted that the tariffs are hitting the company, as he said: Apple develops and sells a broad range of electronic devices, including smartphones, computers, tablets, and wearables .

PepsiCo and Coca-Cola have been moving in opposite directions for a couple of years . Coke shares are up more than 30% from their mid-2023 low . With Warren Buffett close to retiring, companies similar to Berkshire Hathaway are drawing new interest .  PepsiCo, which owns Frito-Lay snack chips and Quaker Oats, just seems to be struggling under the weight of lingering inflation . Credit that to the fact that PepsiCo owns most of its production facilities, whereas Coke largely uses third-party bottlers .  Per-share earnings came up short of expectations as well, prompting the company to dial back its full-year profit guidance . New or recently raised tariffs and crimped consumer demand are both factors . The stock's weakness has pumped up its forward-looking dividend yield to 4.3% versus Coke's 2.8% .  Apple is down more than 20% from its late-2024 high and is still struggling despite the overall market's bounce from its early April low . Apple's recent (and proverbially late to the party) artificial intelligence efforts not resonated with consumers nearly as much as hoped .  Apple's next-generation version of AI-powered Siri may not be released until 2027 . Apple's onboard iPhone hardware will be even more capable of handling intensive generative AI duties by then . Precedence Research believes the digital assistant market is set to grow at an average annualized pace of 24% through 2034 .  New tariffs are largely just part of a bigger negotiation tactic that will eventually end with far more palatable trade agreements . You'll want to make a point of already being in a position in Apple before most other investors start to recognize both of these realities .  Markel owns several privately held companies like Brahmin handbags, Lansing building products, Weldship, and Weldship . It also holds stakes in publicly traded outfits like Alphabet,Visa,Deere, andHome Depot . The ultimate end goal is to amassing enough cash to deploy if and when the right investment opportunity comes along in the future .  Markel shares have performed exceedingly well for a while now, pushing its price beyond analysts' consensus price target of $1,941.50 . There's a lot of measurable value packed in here, even at this recently frothy price . Just don't wait too long if you're going to dive in . Less than a third, or 27%, of executives polled in May by the Association of International Certified Professional Accountants said they were confident about the economic outlook for the 12 months ahead . That's a sharp reversal from the buoyant mood among executives after Donald Trump’s reelection as president .  One in five business executives believe the US is already in a recession, according to the AICPA . Another 34% say they expect one by the end of the year . 75% of those expecting a recession this year or next predict it will be moderate to severe .  Hiring at US companies declined to the slowest pace in two years in May, ADP data shows . Just 14% of respondents say they are looking to hire employees immediately, down from 20% in the first quarter . Expected revenue growth for the coming 12 months is at its most anemic since the third quarter of 2020 .  The AICPA conducted its latest survey from May 5 to May 27, polling 328 members working for US companies . Domestic economic conditions were the top concern cited during the second quarter . Also high on the list of concerns were costs of supplies and equipment .

Counterpoint Research revised down its 2025 global smartphone shipment growth forecast to 1.9% year-on-year from 4.2% due to “renewed uncertainties surrounding U.S. tariffs” Growth projections at both Apple and Samsung were reduced as cost increases were expected to be passed on to consumers .  Counterpoint said Apple’s iPhone 16was the bestselling smartphone in the first quarter . Apple maintained its strong presence in the top 10 list, securing five spots for the fifth consecutive March quarter .  The iPhone is Apple’s biggest selling product, posting $46.8 billion in second-quarter sales, up 2% year-over-year . Southeast Asia and the six Arab nations in the Gulf Cooperation Council are tailwinds for iPhones . Trump has said he’d like to target Apple and Mattel with tariffs aimed at their key products .  President Donald Trump has threatened to impose tariffs on iPhones bound for the US market . Apple CEO Tim Cook said he intended to shift production to India from China . Trump later clarified that the tariffs would be on all imported smartphones .  Needham analysts are concerned about Apple's near-term revenue and earnings growth . Needham downgraded the company to hold from buy without a price target . Apple trades at a forward year-2026 price-to-earnings multiple of more than 26 .  Despite Apple's premium valuation, it is growing revenue and margins the slowest among its big tech competitors . Apple analyst raises alarm about earnings, revenue growth .

The 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals rejected Apple's request to put the provisions on hold as the tech company appeals the judge's order . The judge ordered Apple to end several practices that she said were designed to circumvent the injunction . Apple in a statement said it was "disappointed with the decision not to stay the district court’s order"  Epic Games founder Tim Sweeney said the "long national nightmare of the Apple tax is ended" Epic Games sued Apple in 2020 to loosen its control over transactions in applications that use its iOS operating system and how apps are distributed to consumers . Apple said the ruling blocked the company from "exercising control over core aspects of its business operations"  Apple must allow developers to more easily steer consumers to potentially cheaper non-Apple payment options . Apple defied that court order to maintain a revenue stream worth billions of dollars . She also referred the company and one of its executives to federal prosecutors for a possible criminal contempt investigation .
